conferences.title: Cultural economics: popular festivities and entertainment industry
conferences.description: The conference aims to focus on the advent of the typical economic practices and logics that have guaranteed a status of large markets to the traditional cultural sectors. The lecture will cover the sectors of cultural manifestations in the wide sense, such as popular festivities, and the history of the television market in Brazil.

panelists.name: Paulo Miguez
panelists.resume: doctor of Communication and Contemporary Culture (UFBA), vice-rector of the Federal University of Bahia (2014-2018) and professor of the Institute of Humanities, Arts and Science of UFBA and of the Multidisciplinary Program of Post-graduation on Culture and Society (UFBA).

panelists.name: Fábio Sá Earp
panelists.university: Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro
panelists.resume: Economist and adjunct professor of UFRJ, who has experience in the area of Entertainment Economy, especially Economics of Culture, Tourism, and Sport. Writer of the book Bread and Circuses – Frontiers and perspectives of the entertainment economy (2002), among other important publications.

conferences.title: Collaborative economy: creativity and the future of labor
conferences.description: Collaborative economy, technologies of information, and new forms of labor are in the center of the changes made by the “new economy”. Therefore, the conference will debate the new conditions of production and circulation of cultural and creative goods in contemporary society, after the advent of digital and web gadgets, involving the centrality of the technologies in the overcoming of asymmetric models of diffusion.

panelists.name: Glaucia Campregher
panelists.university: Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul
panelists.resume: Professor of the Department of Economics and International Relations of UFRGS and researcher of the Creative Economy Observatory (OBEC-UFRGS).

panelists.name: Messias Bandeira
panelists.resume: Doctor of Communication and Contemporary Culture (UFBA), adjunct professor of the Institute of Humanities, Arts and Science (IHAC-UFBA), and coordinator of the Creative Economy Observatory of Bahia

conferences.title: Cultural policy: contemporary reflections
conferences.description: The lecturers will debate the context of cultural policy and its impact on local cultural backgrounds, from a public and private spheres’ perspective. The speech will present contemporary discussions about the construction of cultural public policy, in order to set the historic outlook of the role of the State and the role of the private sector in this process, which interchanges with social participation, citizenship, and cultural diversity.

panelists.name: Lia Calabre
panelists.resume: President of the Casa de Rui Barbosa Foundation, historian, master and doctor of Social History (UFF). Her principal areas of study are cultural policy and history of Brazilian radio.

panelists.name: Francisco Marshall
panelists.university: Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul
panelists.resume: Historian and doctor of Social History (USP), professor associate of the Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul, acting on the Department and Port-graduation program of History (IFCH) and in the Post-graduation program of Visual Arts (IA). Marshall is the founder and curator of StudioClio (POA).

conferences.title: Musical and audiovisual economy: a glance at the market from the makers’ perspective
conferences.description: The conference will discuss the cinema and music sectors, from the music and movie makers’ point of view. The lecturers will present the panorama of the audiovisual and musical sectors in Brazil, as well as the main obstacles and advantages for the contemporary cultural production.

panelists.name: Carlos Gerbase
panelists.university: Pontifícia Universidade Católica do Rio Grande do Sul
panelists.resume: Doctor of Social Communication, post-doctor of Cinema (Paris III University – Sorbonne Nouvelle, 2010). He is a professor at PUCRS, movie director, and owner of the production company Prana Filmes.

panelists.name: Pena Schmidt
panelists.university: Ex-presidente da Associação Brasileira da Música Brasileira
panelists.resume: Musical producer, researcher, curator and musical consultant. Pena is a former director of Warner Music and owns the independent label Tinitus. He is also a former director of the Brazilian Association of Independent Music.

conferences.title: Culture in the Global Era
conferences.description: The conference aims to debate contemporary culture as a resource that generates and attracts investment. The lecturers will present an outlook of social and economic development through culture, as well as the current technological mediations that operate these processes, less by instrumentality and more by performativity.

conferences.title: Creative economy and international trade: new business models
conferences.description: The conference aims to propose a debate on international commercial flow of creative goods and services, as well as the business models associated to these processes of internationalization. In a way to compare Brazil and France, the lecturers will present researches and indicators that evaluate the economic impact made by the international trade of the Creative Industries.
